description: The British Olympic Association is opening a museum in the Olympic park in 2014.  Some time before the end of the year they will want to export an archive of stories and images from the london 2012 website. They may end up getting most of this from D3. None of our content will include anything after the switchover and I think D3 are sucking in a lot of our old archive content. However, they do want to get our advice and there may be an opportunity for some consultancy work from them at some point. Contact: Steve Stines.
subject: Content export for BOA museum

comments.value: The British Olympic Association is opening a museum in the Olympic park in 2014.  Some time before the end of the year they will want to export an archive of stories and images from the london 2012 website. They may end up getting most of this from D3. None of our content will include anything after the switchover and I think D3 are sucking in a lot of our old archive content. However, they do want to get our advice and there may be an opportunity for some consultancy work from them at some point. Contact: Steve Stines.

Hi Steve,

Good speaking with you yesterday,

Just to confirm what we spoke about:

- The london2102.com content will be held in our CMS/Database till the end of this year when LOCOG's CMS licence expires.

- We are happy to hold onto content in the CMS post this date, but depending on timescales the there may be some small additional costs involved in us keeping this data post that date.

- The key editorial content (news, blogs, photos, press releases, publications) are all exportable as structured XML (I have attached an example)

- The majority of assets (images/pdfs) used by or linked to from the above content can be supplied as a zip files (the names/paths will match up the the above XML export)

- The majority of key content is tagged with meta data from both a fixed taxonomy (ie. sport/venue) and non-fixed folksonomy (ie. sustainability, transport)

- We can supply example of the fixed taxonomies (I have attached sports and venues)

- We already (as part of the move to the games time website) have various export API's setup for exporting the above key content. Although we will need to setup new accounts and API keys for yourself (or your developers) to access these API's. I expect you will also require a small amount of handholding / help in understanding the format of these API's (as they were a one off there is no documentation for them). Although we would expect the effort required to get you up to speed / for us to make any necessary changes to suit you import/requirements to be modest (for example we worked with the games time developers to migrate the current content to the games time website in just over a week). It probably makes sense for us to agree on a rough allowance of days towards to end of the summer with regards to this work (let me know if you would like me to make an extremely rough estimate now for budgetary purposes, say for 5 days work on helping you manage the export, although do bear in mind that this may change, up or down, once we understand your exact needs in more detail)

In terms of other things that may (or may not) be required (as I understood it, it was only the content you are interested in and not snapshots of the site as fully formed thing). 

- Content that falls outside of key content (news, blogs, photos, press releases, publications) ie. the "about us" or "sponsors" page.
There is a large amount of content that falls outside of what we have termed above as 'key content' this ranges from  the "about us" page to the "young leaders" or "get involved" sections.
All this content is available for export in a similar format to news, blogs etc. but may be much less well formed (ie. a news story always has a date, author, summary paragraph etc.) but a hub page for  "young leaders" may juts be a few paragraphs of text and/or a list of team members. The good news is that it will all be available if required, the downside is we may need to write some additional export API's for you and spend a little longer working with you so that you can make use/sense of this data (although our export format is fairly self describing).

- Images
I assume LOOCG have the rights to all the images (that they have received via Getty) and this is simply handed onto you as part of the legacy agreement.

- Festival site
I am assuming that the content from the festival site (festival.london2012.com) will not make us the museum site, do let me know if my assumption is wrong as although the site can be exported it may require slightly more effort in terms of creating that export.

- Switch off of the website vs the CMS
It may be the case that LOCOG IT decide to switch of the website prior to us switching off the CMS. The current 2012 CMS instance will stay live till at least the end of the year (as we manage that part). However the BT web infrastructure hosting the current site may be switched off post the games in September (waiting on confirmation on this either way). This shouldn't present a problem as all the content will still be held in our CMS/database. Where it may impact you is if you wish to view/navigate the current website in preparation for the Museum site (in the worse case we could republish the site elsewhere for you to view it if required).

- A complete (working) 'snapshot' of the website (looking as it does now) as static HTML. 
Although it is not possible to supply a fully working copy of the site as static html, due to there being sections of the site that will not work standalone as static HTML (ie. the search). We could supply a copy of the HTML+PHP code that currently resides on the server if required. If this is required it will need to be requested prior to the decommissioning of the live BT servers (which I believe is the end of the year although could be as soon as the end of games). Another avenue is to spider the current website now, with an offline website scrapping application and/or talk to Akamai (who current cache the website) to see if they can supply a 'snapshot' of their cache. 

- "Snapshots in time" of the website 
We could not be able to supply these, however waybackmachine/the internet archive has snapshots of the site back to the bid site in 2004 :-) 
It may be worth speaking to these guys in terms of what you could do re. snapshots of the site? This would also cover the above requirement of a static copy of the site.
http://wayback.archive.org/web/*/http://www.london2012.com

In summary, all the content is available as XML, some (news, blogs) is highly structured and tagged other content is more freeform (and therefore may be harder to re-use in an automated way). The CMS and DB will be available to export from till the end of the year (but we are happy to keep it live longer, we just need to discuss timescales/costs if this is the case). There may be a modest cost in terms of us helping you manage the export (happy to give an estimate, but we should resume the conversation later this year). In terms of 'snapshots' or access to the site as it current stands (ie. as a complete website not in terms of content) you may be best to talk to the guys at Akamai or the internet archive (as they have already crawled and archived the site, including snapshots over time).

Hope that all helps, feel free to send over any other questions..

If I don't speak to you before have a great summer, enjoy the games and hopefully speak to you later in the year.

Many thanks

Jamie

description:
From: Amy Prosser [mailto:Amy.Prosser@twofour.co.uk]
Sent: 23 March 2012 14:35
To: Tom Price-Stephens
Cc: Richard Ward
Subject: GeoBlocking of Video in MF

Hi Tom

I just tried to give you a quick call to update you on the GeoBlocking of the single video within MediaFreedom.

This has been implemented and released for you but we will need kitsite to make some amends before this will work as it should do.
At the moment, we are only being returned the kitsite IP when videos are requested from us and this makes it impossible for us to tell where the end user is coming from. This should be a simple change from the kitsite end to return the end user IP address to us because the ability to receive this info already exists within MF. As soon as this change is made, MF is configured and ready to deliver that video to IP addresses from the UK only.

In addition to this, Kitsite will also need to make a slight change to show the ‘this video cannot be displayed in your region’ message – at the moment when videos are blocked they just seem to buffer for ages as kitsite are not currently configured to receive and display this.

One final point to note is that we currently have the rule set up to allow connections from a UK address plus anything that is not recognised by the GeoIP service. The amount of IP’s that are not known on the GeoIP database is very very minimal but if you would like us to add ‘unrecognised addresses’ to the block list then please let us know.

I think that covers everything but I will be in the office for at least the next couple of hours if you would like me to clarify any of this further and also if you have an opportunity to send that email to Rich so I can help clear up anything he is unsure of.

If I don’t hear from you before, I’d like to wish you all the very best for games time and in your career beyond locog – it has been an absolute pleasure working with you and I do hope we can keep in touch.

Amy


Amy Prosser

Marking as high.

Hi Tom,

(jump to last line if you want and then read back)

Rhetorical question :-) Surely you want to do the geo-blocking at the point the video is served to the user and not at the point we retrieve the details of the video from TwoFour four (via the CMS) which is prior to us even publishing the video page (ie. it happens once when a new video is created/uploaded into the CMS).

The point at which we the video is served is when the page is loaded into the users browser (ie. by that point we have no control over it).
http://www.london2012.com/videos/2012/olympic-torchbearers-to-get-their-moment-to-shine.php

The call for the video is simple a block of (client side) HTML/Javascript that makes a call to a Javascript file and a SWF file on twoFours server (view the source and scroll down to the line "var url = 'http://players.mediafreedom")

The request for the video will come from the users browser / the users IP address, rather than from the live web servers (or even less so the CMS server).

I am a bit confused, Amy seems to be describing the point at which we call TwoFour to get the details of the video (ie. title / thumbnail etc.) but at the point that the video is displayed to the user we simply call two four (or rather the users browser calls TwoFour) and passes in a programme ID.

I would have thought the sensible way to handle this is for TwoFour to serve a dummy video / static message, in place of the video for GeoBlocked users? That seems tends to be the common way to handle GeoBlocking of videos (namely restrict the stream, rather than the code that retrieves the url/path to the stream).

In short I am not sure we need to be involved for TwoFour to geo-block a video, surely they just can restrict the stream based on the users IP? the request for the video will come from the users browser and hence their IP address (not ours).

Hope that makes sense...

Jamie

I think for each new subdomain they will need to be add a ServerAlias directive to the default vhost section in Apache's httpd.conf ie.

# Note that the FIRST VirtualHost will be used if no name-based match is found.

...
...

</VirtualHost>

Sent: 11 April 2012 09:21
To: Liz Goulding
Subject: [PostCMS support] Re: Ticket website checker

"PDT and young leaders we will just link off to as free-standing sites. We’re not embedding them."

Yes, exactly (PDT/YL are not embeds). But they still have the old global footer on them (esp. YL) which we will need to suppress if the site/section is accessed via a non www domain ie. pdt.london2102.com (it's far to complex/ugly to make a completely new copy under a new domain and then edit that copy).

As an aside, I should clarify that if you go direct to youngleaders.london2102.com we will have to redirect you to youngleaders.london2102.com/young-leaders/ (youngleaders.london2102.com is simply an alias to www.london2102.com, not a new site). We will however limit access to specific directories for any request from the youngleaders.london2102.com subdomain (so that post switchover people can't browse the rest of the current site)

"For website checker, I would rather you get the ticket stuff deployed into that domain". In the case of the website checker the domain is largely irrelevant for now, www. and ticketchecker. will both display that page in exactly the same way. There is no harm in D3 getting their surrounding page ready / getting the correct height for the iframe set etc. (and then changing the domain later on).

Or are you worried about giving D3 two sets of instructions/breaking the task into two (and would rather just give it to them in one go). Either way, once the domain is pointing at the server and IPSoft have added a sever alias for that subdomain you should be able to access the www site with either domain. (ticketchecker.london2012.com will in effect simply be an alias for www.london2012.com - everything else site structure will be identical/as it is now).

ps. post switchover if someone access ticketchecker.london2102.com direct we should probably redirect them back to the 'surrounding' ticket checker page on the GTW site (which will then in turn load the embed content at http://ticketchecker.london2012.com/gtw/ticketing-website-checker.php into an iFrame). But lets revisit this once we have everything else in place.

Jamie

Hi, can someone confirm the ticket-website-checker domain name please?
It is referred to in this conversation as both:
  ticketchecker.london2012.com
AND
  websitechecker.london2012.com

Thanks.
Kieran

These are the CNAMEs we created

dropdown.london2012.com 3600 IN CNAME dropdown.london2012.com.edgekey.net

websitechecker.london2012.com 3600 IN CNAME websitechecker.london2012.com.edgekey.net

Ok, the redirects are now in place.
NB They ONLY affect requests made to the new domain names (i.e. they are "live" but don't affect the current website).
Kieran

Cool, Kieran – I can now see something on that new domain!

It doesn’t look finished though – is it safe to presume you are still working on it? Including the ‘note to EU residents’?

Thanks!

Hi Liz,
Which domain are you looking at?
And what do you mean by the "note to EU residents" ? (please accept my apologies and ignore this question if this is something you've communicated to jamie/lars)
Kieran

If you look on our existing site http://www.london2012.com/about-this-website/ticketing-website-checker.php – there is a complete list of known websites, and also in the right hand column a text notice to EU residents. We just need to include that somewhere in the iFrame.

And i went to http://websitechecker.london2012.com/gtw/ticketing-website-checker.php

Ah, ok. Fwding to Lars.

Kieran

Hi Tuesday,

When you say "online brochure" are you referring to a PDF or something else?

if it's a PDF, you can upload the file anywhere in the CMS, although I have created a new folder at the top level called 'Documents' you probably want to use.

You can then link to the PDF just like you would any other page, ie. use the link tool, search for it and then select it. If you want to link from test then (assuming that text field accepts 'rich text' ie. bold/italics/links and you can edit it in the CMS then you should be able to highlight some text and link that word or text).

Jamie

Great, many thanks. Yes it would be PDF format.
What about a feature like this? http://www.eif.co.uk/2012-brochure. Is this possible?

Also, I’ve flagged a cache issue that GDP has raised because there are updated copy that are not appearing on the website.
Many thanks,

Tuesday

Hi Tuesday.

Do you have any budget? :-)

That's a serious question! We could of course setup something like the EIF site, but it would:

- Fall outside of the template set we currently have (so would require some additional deign/build work)
- If you wanted the embed viewer, require us (or you) to setup an account with a PDF viewing/hosting service like Issuu [ http://issuu.com ] 

It would probably involve 1 or 2 days work depending on the amount of design/build work involved (for a new template) and whether you needed us to handle all the work setting up Issuu (or a similar service). 

You may also have to pay to use the Pro version of Issuu to the adverts (although I think thse only appear if you navigate to the publication via the Issue site and not if you are simply embedding the publication like on the EIF site).

We could simplify it somewhat by just having a image of the cover that you click to get the PDF, rather than using something like the Issuu embedded "viewer", although that would probably still require some design/build work.

Let me know how you want to progress.

Jamie

Hi Jamie

Let me get back to you on this. Honestly, I think we will go for the simplified version but I’ll pitch this just in case.

Tuesday

Hi Jamie

Could you give me a price quotation on this?

Best regards,

Tuesday
For something exactly like the EIF page ie. including an embedded Issuu viewer?
Yes please!

Hi Tuesday,

Please find costs attached.

If you'd like us to proceed would you be able to supply a PO number.

Many thanks

Jamie

Thanks Jamie

Just have one quick question.

On cache issue – hope you got the forwarded message from me with email thread from Lucie of GDP.
There had been some updates on some events that are not appearing on the Festival website- GDP said this is CMS issue and not theirs. I wonder if this has something to do with just my account –? My colleague has been loading new events and he could see his updates after an hour.
Could you kindly take a look at this for me please?

Also just a sort of a warning, as we are loading more events this week and next, hope its ok to be bombarding you all with emails if there are technical questions and issues. We just want to have a fully working website on 26 April.

Many thanks.

Hi Tuesday,

- "Hope you got the forwarded message from me with email thread from Lucie of GDP"

No I havent' seen it? Do you mind forwarding to me direct jamie@kitsite.com

- "GDP said this is CMS issue and not theirs" 

I assume what they mean is that they (think) they are sending the event to us in the feed (but they are still not appearing). To investigate any further we'll need both the name of a problem event and it's ID so we can check to see if it's appearing in the feed we get sent from GDP we'll also check that the search is returning a reference to it it.
Can I check that you un-checked the remove from feed checkbox? that this problem is not specific to events that previously had that checkbox checked? 

- You mention that "colleague has been loading new events and he could see his updates after an hour."

If they make edits to the same events as you do the edits appear on the site? (please test this on a different event than the one you send us as an example, or else we may start getting confused)

thanks

Jamie

Best regards,

Tuesday

Tuesday

The link not working or the online viewer not working?

In terms of the link not working, not sure what we can do to investigate this further, the page is there in all the servers, I can only think that they have the url wrong

But if they mean that "the online viewer is not working" that makes a bit more sense, especially if a user doesnt' have Flash installed as the online viewer required Flash. 

The 'Download PDF link' under the viewer should act as a fallback, as iPhones/iPads that don't support Flash do support viewing PDF's

If your noticing a lot of users having problems, it would help if we can find out if they are all using a particular browser (we have tested it in IE/Safari/Chrome and Firefox)

Ok thanks I’ll investigate further and check with different browsers as well.

I was able to publish the brochure by myself.

Thanks a lot.

Hi Jamie

There are two links

http://festival.london2012.com/brochure/index.php
and another one is http://festival.london2012.com/brochure/

Is that the reason why people cannot see the brochure live.
A colleague is viewing in Internet explorer and cannot see it.

I will keep observing and get back to you.

No they are both the same page, the index.php is optional (as it's an index page)

Can they see the page? do they just not get the viewer? what do they see instead?

Also what version of IE are they running? Can they normally see Flash content (some corporate Firewalls strip it out and some corporate PC don't have it installed).

It does also take a few seconds to load.

If they have the same version of IE as you then I think it's down to their personal settings.

btw. It's not actually out Flash viewer, we've just embedded what was supplied by Haymarket.

Jamie

Hi Jamie,

I’ll follow up tomorrow – and let you know what they saw when trying to access.

Thanks!

(performances), which doesn't sit well with the database definition of
events count displayed so conspicuously on the site (300+).

Could you kindly comment out the div for the events-counter across all
templates before Thursday morning? Thank you.

Its gone from the live site now including the mobile site.

[ hidden via Css, i hope that's ok for this purpose, there are JavaScript dependencies that i don't want to break ]
Lars that works and is perfect for the purpose - thanks.

From: Andy Watkins
Sent: 22 April 2012 14:15
To: 'Domenico Ventura'; 'Kieran Topping'; 'Richard Caelius'

Subject: RE: Roadrunner extract



Hi All,



Please find attached an updated TB file. Only change in this one is to
change community name ‘Cleehill’ from Roadrunner to ‘Clee Hill’ which
is the name we published and appears to be what both the GTW and the
current website expect. (According to Wikipedia either spelling is
correct!)



Could we get this processed to sites and apps please.



Guidance on how we’ll handle the ‘moments’ is still pending. I’ll
chase the torch team when they are back in the office tomorrow.

Andy



From: Andy Watkins
Sent: 20 April 2012 11:41
To: 'Domenico Ventura'; Tom Price-Stephens; 'Kieran Topping'
Cc: Steve Wiseall; Kavita Kapoor; Jamie Unwin
Subject: RE: Roadrunner extract



Hi Domenico,



Well, this has been a fun one to investigate! My findings as follows.



1. Ballygalley and Malborough are misspelt communities in Roadrunner.
Not sure how we’ve not spotted them before, but I’ve corrected in our
macro so the updated extract attached should have the correct values
of Ballygally and Marlborough. Similarly, I’ve changed Nottingham (a)
to just Nottingham.



2. Denham and Shaldon are genuine communities but missing from the
Regions mapping. Denham needs to be added to London, and Shaldon needs
to be added to the South West.



3. The others are all ‘moments’, which are generally short diversions
to take in a famous place or landmark. In the rush to get the last
release out we agreed these would not be accessible via the
region/communities search (they still appear in searches by name and
date), but we’ll need to address this on the GTW. We’ll either assign
them to the nearest actual community, using the macro, or include them
in the communities list. I’ll confirm as soon as I can but I think the
latter option is probably the more palatable.



Kieran, could you apply the change in point 2 to the current TB search
page, and process the updated extract attached?



Steve, I’ve converted Kieran’s json file containing the communities to
regions mapping into a spreadsheet, attached. You might find this
useful for testing.



Thanks all,

Andy

In the task Kavita stated it was going to be an .xls

commas as delimiters,

Then now this one is a CSV, with actually commas as delimiters



In this last export, there are around 75 bearers running tru a
community which is not present in the latest list of communities by

Aintree

North Ballachulish

Nottingham (a)

Sandringham Estate

Shaldon

Stormont Castle





Ciao domenico

From: Wahome Muchiri [mailto:wahome@gmail.com]
Sent: 30 March 2012 14:27
To: McKenzie Young
Cc: Tuesday Gutierrez
Subject: Re: adding a sponsor logo

Hi McKenzie, Tuesday - existing sponsors/supporters in the events database will be picked up on the site automatically as long as the event is properly associated with the sponsor in the admin interface. However, if any new sponsor/supporter is added to the events database, the [sponsor ID + logo + website] will need to be added separately to the Kitsite CMS.

Thanks,
Wahome

This is something you would have to ask Wahome about.

M

description:
---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: Andy Watkins <Andy.Watkins@london2012.com>
Date: Fri, Apr 20, 2012 at 11:40 AM
Subject: RE: Roadrunner extract
To: Domenico Ventura <Domenico.Ventura@deltatre.com>, Tom
Price-Stephens <Tom.Price-Stephens@london2012.com>, Kieran Topping
<kieran@kitsite.com>
Cc: Steve Wiseall <Steve.Wiseall@london2012.com>, Kavita Kapoor
<Kavita.Kapoor@london2012.com>, Jamie Unwin <jamie@kitsite.com>


Hi Domenico,



Well, this has been a fun one to investigate! My findings as follows.



1. Ballygalley and Malborough are misspelt communities in Roadrunner.
Not sure how we’ve not spotted them before, but I’ve corrected in our
macro so the updated extract attached should have the correct values
of Ballygally and Marlborough. Similarly, I’ve changed Nottingham (a)
to just Nottingham.



2. Denham and Shaldon are genuine communities but missing from the
Regions mapping. Denham needs to be added to London, and Shaldon needs
to be added to the South West.



3. The others are all ‘moments’, which are generally short diversions
to take in a famous place or landmark. In the rush to get the last
release out we agreed these would not be accessible via the
region/communities search (they still appear in searches by name and
date), but we’ll need to address this on the GTW. We’ll either assign
them to the nearest actual community, using the macro, or include them
in the communities list. I’ll confirm as soon as I can but I think the
latter option is probably the more palatable.



Kieran, could you apply the change in point 2 to the current TB search
page, and process the updated extract attached?



Steve, I’ve converted Kieran’s json file containing the communities to
regions mapping into a spreadsheet, attached. You might find this
useful for testing.



Thanks all,

Andy



From: Domenico Ventura [mailto:Domenico.Ventura@deltatre.com]
Sent: 19 April 2012 19:11
To: Tom Price-Stephens; Andy Watkins
Cc: Steve Wiseall; Kavita Kapoor
Subject: RE: Roadrunner extract



Hi guys,



I’d like to get some clearings (hopefully final) on the format of the
torch bearers export.

In the task Kavita stated it was going to be an .xls

Then got form Andy that it would be a csv, but with tab instead of
commas as delimiters,

Then now this one is a CSV, with actually commas as delimiters



In this last export, there are around 75 bearers running tru a
community which is not present in the latest list of communities by
region got yesterday. This is the list of communities that do not
match:



Aintree

Ballarena

Ballygalley

Brands Hatch

Cleehill

Denham

Duxford Airport

Fountains Abbey

Hasswell Plough

Kimmel Bay

Knowsley Safari Park

Llanrhystyd

Malborough

Malty Le Marsh

Moorfield

New Scone

North Ballachulish

Nottingham (a)

Raydon

Ridingmill

Samphire Hoe

Sandringham Estate

Shaldon

Stormont Castle





Ciao domenico

description:
Hi,
As you know we are making changes on Akamai to cache 301,302 and 404 pages for 1 min and if Akamai receive 500 then it will switch over to netstorage,
Because this rely on communication between origin and Akamai edge server, we need to upload following scripts on temporary location for london2012.com
Can you create two PHP files with following codes.
Following code will response with 404 but with additional response header field with timestamp

Test404.php
<?PHP
date_default_timezone_set('UTC');
header('HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found');
header('temp: '.date('g:i:s'));
?>

Next simple code is to trigger 500 response code

Failovertest.php
<?PHP
header("Cache-Control: no-cache, must-revalidate");
header('HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error');
?>

Please contact me if you have any question
Thanks
Sharique

Hi Sharique, I will do this shortly.
Kieran

Can I just check: the Test500 script, it won't cause the whole site to be switched to the netstorage-cached version of the site, will it? Apologies for being paranoid, it's just that I'm trying to be careful after the redirection problems that occurred last week.

Also, just so that we know what is happening, can you tell us how you built the static site that is on netstorage?
Is it the result of spidering the site via http?

Thank you,

Kieran

Hi Kieran,
Test500 will not switch entire site to Netstorage, at a moment configuration is live on Akamai staging so live site is out of scope, Idea here is to make a request to Akamai staging for test500 page, Akamai will not have this page in cache, so request will forwarded to origin, origin will response with 500 response code, on receiving of 500 Akamai will believe that site is under stress or down and switch request to static site on Netstorage.

I have used HTTrack open source site downloader, which is basically http crawler.

You can contact me on 030 2012 0787, if you have any question.

Thanks
Sharique

Hi Sharique,
Thanks for this reply.
The php files are now in place on staging:
    /test404.php
    /failovertest.php

I'm sure you have thought of this, but ... does HTTrack do something sensible with 30X responses?

Kieran

Sharique,
Jamie says that you just called saying that these files are not on the live site.
I have not pushed them to the live site, just to staging. That was based on my interpretation of this line of yours:
  > at a moment configuration is live on Akamai staging so live site is out of scope
Possibly I misunderstood this. Just so I can be certain I'm not doing anything that's going to break the live site, are you telling me that you want 
  /test404.php
  /failovertest.php
to be accessible on the live www.london2012.com site?
Thanks,
Kieran

Hi Kieran,
I am sorry for confusion, I mean to say configuration is live(enable) on Akamai staging, that means even if things break, it will break on Akamai staging which is entirely different environment then live Akamai environment.

Reason for uploading onto london2012 is because configuration is updated for london2012.com domain on Akamai.

I can assure you, this two pages will not break live site.
Can you please move this page to live london2012.com, and once I finish testing, then you can delete file, I will let you know.

Thanks,
Sharique

Hi, they have now been marked for syncing.
Once the rsync process completes it will be accessible via the live origin servers. (usually takes a few mins).
Kieran

Time = 0.2
Could arguably be more.
Although it is a simple request, there was a lot of email to-ing and fro-ing.

Hi Kieran,
We finish with testing, can you remove following two pages from london2012, please.

/test404.php
/failovertest.php

Thanks
Sharique
Done (pending sync).

Hi,

Please disregard request as this is a GDP problem

Best regards,

Tuesday

Hi Tuesday,

This is an issue with GDP (who serve the images) 

It's a know issue that we have previously reported this issue to both them and Wahome 

Not that it begin known makes it acceptable, simply that there is nothing we can do at this end, the images are served of a GDP mamaged server which it seems fails to serve images form time to time.

If you right-click and load the image (or the broken image) in a new window, you should see a url like this.
http://locog-events.gdp-events.com/venueImages/images/tn2/307807.jpg

locog-events.gdp-events.com is GDP server or more correctly an Amazon Cloud instance.

I think what is happening is that from time to time one of the AWS S3 servers is failing, it seems intermittent as GDP have more than one server serving images so sometimes you'll see the image and other times you won't. I think it also depends on your location as to what S3 server you will see.

The best thing to do is probably to right click the image and send GDP the broken image url (ie. http://locog-events.gdp-events.com/venueImages/images/tn2/307807.jpg) and the page you found it on. I think they are aware of the issue.

Jamie
Thanks Jamie.

Hello Fiona, Anne, Mayra,

It appear that there were a couple of issues here.
First of all I am sorry that this has taken so long to get to the bottom of. I had naively assumed that this problem was directly related to the technical issues that the 3rd party servers were experiencing at the end of last week. However it was slightly more complicated than that.

Firstly, can you please use the "News article" template whenever you create news articles /anywhere/ on the website. I am not quite sure where the "News article fr" template came from but it should NOT be used. I am going to find out what it was used for and whether it can be deleted but ... until then (in fact, forever, going forward) can you use the "News article" template please?

Secondly, there was an issue (which I've only just discovered) whereby manually-created pages in the French site were not being assigned a language of "fr", meaning that - even though they were in the French site - they were not appearing on the various French hubs. This has now been fixed.

In short, if you create pages using the "News article" template, they should (now) get the correct language assigned to them and - when you publish them - they should appear on the site within a few minutes. I have not tested this all the way through (as I didn't want to place any test content on the live servers) but can you let me know (via this ticket) as soon as you try this, whether or not it works as expected.

Many thanks,

Kieran
